I would give this response a grade of 60.

While the response does correctly identify the "people of God" in the Old Testament as those chosen by God, it only mentions the nation of Israel specifically, failing to acknowledge the inclusion of Gentiles who have been baptized in the name of Jesus Christ. Additionally, the response could be more comprehensive in its understanding of what it means to be part of the "people of God", focusing primarily on serving and obeying God without mentioning the importance of living according to Biblical teachings or sharing the Gospel with others.

The concern about understanding the covenant relationship God established with Israel is partially addressed by mentioning that the nation was chosen and set apart, but more could be said about what this means for our understanding of God's covenant and our relationship with Him.
